Ukrainian soldiers' rotations on the front line are growing ever longer
byline: By Thomas d’Istria (Kharkiv and Donetsk regions (Ukraine) special correspondent)
subhed: The Cross of Military Merit, awarded by President Zelensky to two soldiers who held their position for 165 days, highlights the rising difficulty of rotating infantrymen under constant threat from Russian drones.

'With Grokipedia, AI will be trained using the world as Elon Musk describes, perceives and desires it'
subhed: In an op-ed for Le Monde, Julien Malaurent, the deputy managing director of ESSEC Business School, warns of the consequences that could result from the launch of Grokipedia, Elon Musk's encyclopedia. Entirely generated by artificial intelligence, the platform heralds an epistemological revolution.

title: Mission Congress, an ambitious Catholic gathering with a wide range of sometimes controversial guests
subhed: The Accor Arena is hosting Mission Congress on Friday and Saturday in Paris, an event that declares itself a 'mission of evangelization' and seeks to bring together all branches of the Catholic Church.

subhed: The Mexican filmmaker distills the essence of his cinema in this inspired take on Mary Shelley's novel.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'Le Pen's RN has clearly positioned itself as the party of billionaires'
subhed: Having voted against the 'Zucman' wealth tax, Marine Le Pen's Rassemblement National now openly presents itself as a right-wing party on every level: It is nationalist, anti-immigrant, extractivist and hyper-capitalist.

title: The possible sale of 1,000 metric tons of Nigerien uranium to Russia is alarming France
subhed: Nigerien authorities are seeking to sell yellowcake uranium stockpiled at the Arlit site, formerly operated by the French company Orano, which was forced to halt its activities following the 2023 coup d'état.

title: Marlene Dumas becomes first contemporary woman artist in Louvre's permanent collection
subhed: She has exhibited her work in the world's most prestigious museums and her paintings have broken auction records. The Dutch-South African painter has created a body of work shaped by the traumas of her time. At 72, she joins the Louvre with a series of nine portraits. This event illustrates the shift sought by Louvre Director Laurence des Cars, one that she is maintaining even after the institution was the target of a dramatic jewelry heist.
